intro: Aulonemia amplissima, commonly known as the broad-leaved aulonemia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its large, broad leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Aulonemia amplissima is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and vibrant blooms.
